cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi west of Port Charlotte, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to slow and turn northwest then north-northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana to Mississippi coast)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast, near or just east of the mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Ocean Springs MS to the AL/FL border; Storm Surge Watch MS/AL border to AL/FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (metro New Orleans); Storm Surge Warning Port Fourchon LA to the MS/AL border including Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas & Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama and into the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely Monday night with a 35% onset probability; hurricane-force gusts possible Tuesday with 36% cumulative chance of 50-kt winds and up to 14% chance of 64-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 4–6 ft forecast on Lakes Pontchartrain and Maurepas and 7–11 ft at the mouth of the Mississippi River, which will inundate low-lying terminals and approaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated 20 inch totals possible, producing significant flash and urban flooding in and around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged heavy rain may cause river flooding; large waves and dangerous rip currents will hamper vessel movements; possible tornadoes in outer rain bands.
